edu.rit.pjmr

Class Mapper<I,C,K,V extends Vbl>

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.pjmr.Mapper<I,C,K,V>
  • Type Parameters:
    I - Data type for data record ID.
    C - Data type for data record contents.
    K - Output key data type.
    V - Output value data type; must implement interface Vbl.

    public abstract class Mapper<I,C,K,V extends Vbl>
extends java.lang.Object
    Class Mapper is the abstract base class for a mapper in the Parallel Java Map Reduce Framework. See class PjmrJob for further information about configuring mappers as part of a PJMR job.

    A MapperTask calls a mapper's methods as follows:

    1. The mapper task calls the mapper's start() method. The arguments are the mapper's argument strings if any, and the Combiner that will accumulate the mapper's results. The start() method may initialize the mapper based on the argument strings. The start() method may do preprocessing operations on the combiner.

    2. The mapper task repeatedly calls the mapper's map() method. The arguments are a data record's ID and contents, as well as the Combiner. The map() method extracts an output key and an output value from the data record and adds the (key, value) pair to the combiner. Alternatively, the map() method extracts an output key from the data record and adds a (key, null) pair to the combiner; this signifies that the output key exists but has no associated value. Alternatively, the map() method decides there is nothing of interest in the data record, and adds nothing to the combiner. The map() method may add zero, one, or more than one (key, value) pair to the combiner. The map() method may do other operations on the combiner as well.

    3. When there are no more data records, the mapper task calls the mapper's finish() method, passing in the Combiner. The finish() method may do postprocessing operations on the combiner.

    If a mapper task has more than one mapper, the mappers are run in parallel in separate threads. There is one global combiner, and each mapper works with its own thread-local copy of the combiner. (A mapper cannot see the other mappers' thread-local combiners.) When the mappers have finished, the thread-local combiners are automatically reduced into the global combiner.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start(java.lang.String[] args,
         Combiner<K,V> combiner)
        Start this mapper.

        The base class start() method does nothing. A subclass may override the start() method to do something.

        Parameters:
        args - Array of zero or more argument strings.
        combiner - Thread-local combiner.

      • map

        public abstract void map(I id,
       C contents,
       Combiner<K,V> combiner)
        Map the given record ID and record contents to a (key, value) pair. The key must be non-null; the value may be null. The map() method adds the (key, value) pair to the given combiner.

        The map() method must be overridden in a subclass.

        Parameters:
        id - Data record ID.
        contents - Data record contents.
        combiner - Thread-local combiner.

      • finish

        public void finish(Combiner<K,V> combiner)
        Finish this mapper.

        The base class finish() method does nothing. A subclass may override the finish() method to do something.

        Parameters:
        combiner - Thread-local combiner.

      • customizer

        public Customizer<K,V> customizer()
        Returns the Customizer for this mapper's mapper task.
        Returns:
        Customizer.
